tags.name: pdf-element
tags.description:
Polymer element which renders PDF documents. It uses [PDF.js](https://mozilla.github.io/pdf.js/) library behind.

Example:

Minimum configuration:
```html
<pdf-element src="../example.pdf" width=800 height=600></pdf-element>
```
Optionally following parameters could be triggered:
- `elevation` material elevation;
- `downloadable` to be able to download document;
- `show-file-name` to show name of the file in the PDF toolbar.


```html
<pdf-element src="../example.pdf" elevation="5" downloadable show-file-name width=800 height=600></pdf-element>
```

Another awesome feature is dynamically load PDF file. So you can change the `src` attribute of the element and document will be automatically reloaded (checkout the demo):

```html
<pdf-element src="[[pdfFile]]" width=800 height=600></pdf-element>
```

attributes.name: src
attributes.description: Source of a PDF file.

attributes.name: elevation
attributes.description: The z-depth of this element, from 0-5. Setting to 0 will remove the shadow, and each increasing number greater than 0 will be "deeper" than the last.

attributes.name: downloadable
attributes.description: If provided then download icon will appear on the toolbar to download file.

attributes.name: show-file-name
attributes.description: If provided then file name will be shown on the toolbar.

attributes.name: show-spinner
attributes.description:
If provided then during page rendering loading spinner will be shown.
Maybe used for documents with many images for example.

attributes.name: enable-text-selection
attributes.description: If provided then text selection will be enabled.

attributes.name: fit-width
attributes.description: If provided then the document will be zoomed to maximum width initially.

attributes.name: width
attributes.description: If provided then the width will be set.

properties.name: src
properties.description: Source of a PDF file.

If provided then during page rendering loading spinner will be shown.
Maybe used for documents with many images for example.

properties.name: enableTextSelection
properties.description: If provided then text selection will be enabled.

properties.name: fitWidth
properties.description: If provided then the document will be zoomed to maximum width initially.

properties.name: width
properties.description: If provided then the width will be set.
